title: Counterclockwise.
abstract: A saddle type vehicle for permitting a change from a cruiser to a sport mode, a stand and front and rear steps. In the sport mode, a rider is in a forward-tilted posture with first and second link plates in a wide-spread state. The bend angle θ1 between a first line segment and a second line segment is a little less than 180°. When the first and second link plates are folded into a V-shape, a rear structure body is turned counterclockwise and a front structure body is turned clockwise. The bend angle θ2 is reduced. The road clearance of a drive source support case is smaller with the position of center of gravity and the seat being lower. As a result, a cruiser mode is achieved. While being a single vehicle, a change in the position of its center of gravity and in the vehicle body form is achieved.
